file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 33-31-05-04 - BAGGAGE COMPARTMENT LIGHT LAVATORY SWITCH - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL BAGGAGE COMPARTMENT LIGHT LAVATORY SWITCH - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: FOR AIRCRAFT WITH BAGGAGE COMPARTMENT LIGHT LAVATORY SWITCH 1. General A. This section gives the procedures for the removal/installation of the baggage compartment light lavatory switch. B. This switch is installed at the header panel, on the lavatory/baggage compartment partition. C. The function of this switch is to turn ON/OFF the baggage compartment lights. D. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY FOR AIRCRAFT WITH BAGGAGE COMPART- BAGGAGE COMPARTMENT LIGHT LAVA- 33-31-05-000-801-A MENT LIGHT LAVATO- TORY SWITCH - REMOVAL RY SWITCH FOR AIRCRAFT WITH BAGGAGE COMPART- BAGGAGE COMPARTMENT LIGHT LAVA- 33-31-05-400-801-A MENT LIGHT LAVATO- TORY SWITCH - INSTALLATION RY SWITCH EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 33-31-05 Page 1 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 33-31-05-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: FOR AIRCRAFT WITH BAGGAGE COMPARTMENT LIGHT LAVATORY SWITCH 2. BAGGAGE COMPARTMENT LIGHT LAVATORY SWITCH - REMOVAL A. General (1) This task gives the procedures to remove the baggage compartment light lavatory switch. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM TASK 25-27-02-000-801-A/400 - C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 271 Lavatory 272 Lavatory D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Lavatory I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) On the circuit breaker panel, open the COMPT lights circuit breaker and attach a DO- NOT-CLOSE tag to it (Location tip: DC BUS 2/LIGHT/COMPT). (2) On the right power and control distribution box, open the COMPT LT circuit breaker and attach a DO-NOT-CLOSE tag to it (Location tip: DC BUS 2/LIGHT/COMPT). (3) Remove the cable column cover assembly from the cable protection shroud. Refer to AMM TASK 25-27-02-000-801-A/400. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 33-31-05 Page 2 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL J. Removal (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-002-A (1) Remove the nut (5) and springwasher (3) that attach the switch to the cable column cover assembly. (2) Remove the tiedown strap (8). (3) Remove the two heating tubes (7) that cover the two terminal lugs (6). (4) Remove the two screws (2) and two lockwashers (1) that attach the two terminal lugs (6) to the switch terminal. (5) Pull the baggage compartment light lavatory switch (4) to remove it from the cable column cover assembly. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 33-31-05 Page 3 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

TERMINAL LUG (2) DET C 145AMM330385.MCE EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 33-31-05 Page 4 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details. FWD

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 33-31-05-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: FOR AIRCRAFT WITH BAGGAGE COMPARTMENT LIGHT LAVATORY SWITCH 3. BAGGAGE COMPARTMENT LIGHT LAVATORY SWITCH - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This task gives the procedures to install the baggage compartment light lavatory switch. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM TASK 25-27-02-400-801-A/400 - BAGGAGE AND SERVICE COMPARTMENT LIGHTS - AMM TASK 33-30-00-700-801-A/500 OPERATIONAL TEST MIL-S-23190 - C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 271 Lavatory 272 Lavatory D. Tools and Equipment ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially To supply hot air over the heat-shrinkable Heat Gun available sleeve E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials SPECIFICATION DESCRIPTION QTY (BRAND) MIL-I-23053 Heat-shrinkable Sleeve RNF-100 1/8-9 AR G. Expendable Parts IPC REFERENCE ITEM QTY (VENDOR REFERENCE) Tiedown strap MIL-S-23190 1 H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Lavatory EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 33-31-05 Page 5 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL I. Installation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 420-002-A (1) Put the baggage compartment light lavatory switch (4) in its installation position. (2) Connect the two terminal lugs (6) to the switch with the two screws (2) and two lockwashers (1). (3) Tighten the two screws (2) and two lockwashers (1) that attach the two terminal lugs to the switch. (4) Install the four heating tubes (7) to cover the switch terminals. NOTE: Only two terminals of the switch are connected to the aircraft. However, the four terminals must be covered with the heating tube. (5) Install the new tiedown strap (8) to attach the electrical wire. (6) Tighten the nut (5) and springwasher (3) to attach the switch (4) to the cable column cover assembly. J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) Install the cable column cover assembly to the cable protection shroud. Refer to AMM TASK 25-27-02-400-801-A/400. (2) On the circuit breaker panel, remove the DO-NOT-CLOSE tag from the COMPT lights circuit breaker and close it (Location tip: DC BUS 2/LIGHT/COMPT). (3) On the right power and control distribution box, remove the DO-NOT-CLOSE tag from the COMPT LT and close it (Location tip: RB SERV BUS/COMPT) (4) Do the baggage compartment operational test ( AMM TASK 33-30-00-700-801-A/500).
